nodes.bodyText: Do we also need to add android:theme="@android:style/Theme.Translucent.NoTitleBar" to prevent any sort of flicker when the activity is opened then closed quickly? I remember this was needed to fix some brief visual issues but don't remember the exact details, may only be an issue on older Android devices.

android:theme="@android:style/Theme.Translucent.NoTitleBar"
There is no flicker due to this theme but in combination with the delete Intent, having this theme will end on making the application lose its title color
Mike tried to switch this notification dismiss action to an Activity before in the past and it resulted in a visual flicker. Do these flags completely prevent that?
good catch! there is no flicker but the process is being closed

We might have to use a BroadcastReceiver for the dismisses. If we use an Activity for dismisses it could result in odd focus behavior in the app with extra onPause and onResume calls each time a notification is swiped away we would want to avoid.
Yeah, seems like the most reasonable solution, using intent for dismissing tracking, ends on weirds behaviors
Now that this receiver only handles closes this would be a good time to rename it NotificationDismissReceiver
Instead of NotificationOpenedActivity shouldn't this be NotificationOpenedReceiver or NotificationDismissReceiver?
The more correct terminology would be "dismissed" instead of "closed" for a notification.

This runtime check was in place since there was a change in a non-major release and we had to support both as someone may not have updated their AndroidManifest.xml.
We can now just safely assume NotificationDismissReceiver will always be there now in 4.0.0
We can safely remove the openerIsBroadcast check as the open action will always be an Activity
